file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-13-02-04 - MAIN-DOOR STEP FOLD-OUT BACKSTOP - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL MAIN-DOOR STEP FOLD-OUT BACKSTOP - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the step fold-out backstop attached to the fuselage, on the main door rear frame, above the floor panel. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH AIR- MAIN DOOR STEP FOLD-OUT BACK- 52-13-02-000-801-A STAIRS DOOR STOP - REMOVAL AIRCRAFT WITH AIR- MAIN DOOR STEP FOLD-OUT BACK- 52-13-02-400-801-A STAIRS DOOR STOP - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-13-02 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-13-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR 2. MAIN DOOR STEP FOLD-OUT BACKSTOP - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the step fold-out backstop. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 52-10-00/1 AMM TASK 25-23-02-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-23-02-000-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-03-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-803-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-804-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-27-04-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-07-000-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 231 Passenger cabin, LH 811 Main door D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To remove the bolts available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) ASTM-D-740 Methyl Ethyl Ketone - MEK AR EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-13-02 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the main door I. Preparation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Open the main door (AMM SDS 52-10-00/1). (2) Remove the emergency equipment stowage unit (AMM TASK 25-26-03-000-801-A/ 400, if applicable) or the LH wardrobe (AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-803-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-804-A/400) or the windscreen (AMM TASK 25-27-04-000-801-A/400, if applicable) or the LH galley (AMM TASK 25-30-07-000-801-A/400), as applicable. (3) Remove the first skirting lining panel (11), the one near the main door (AMM TASK 25-23-02-000-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 25-23-02-000-802-A/400), as applicable. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Pull the thermoacoustic blanket (12) to access the bolts (6). (2) Remove the nuts (9) (3 positions), washers (8) and (7) (3 positions), the shims (10) and bolts (6) (3 positions). (3) Remove the step fold-out backstop (13). (4) If necessary, remove the roller (2), as follows: (a) Remove the cotter pin (5), nut (4), washer (3) and the screw (1). (b) Remove the roller (2). WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING WHEN YOU HANDLE THEM. DO NOT BREATHE THEIR GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (5) With a cloth soaked in MEK, clean the surface. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-13-02 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR Step Fold-out Backstop - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 811 14. METAL STRUCTURE 13. STEP FOLD-OUT BACKSTOP B DET. A 11. SKIRTING LINING PANEL DET. B 12. THERMOACOUSTIC BLANKET C 10. SHIM 1 9. NUT (3) 1. SCREW 2. ROLLER 3. WASHER 1 4. NUT 8. WASHER (3) 5. COTTERPIN DET. C 6. BOLT (3) 7. WASHER (3) 1 THE WASHERS (POS. 8) AND NUTS (POS. 9) ARE BEHIND THE METAL STRUCTURE (POS. 14) EM145AMM520359A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-13-02 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-13-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR 3. MAIN DOOR STEP FOLD-OUT BACKSTOP - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the step fold-out backstop. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 52-10-00/1 AMM TASK 25-23-02-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-23-02-400-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-03-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-04-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-04-400-804-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-27-04-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-07-400-801-A/400 - MAIN-DOOR STEP ACTUATING MECHANISM - AD- AMM TASK 52-10-01-820-802-A/500 JUSTMENT IPC 53-21-00 CENTRAL I TASK 25-24-04-400-803-A - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 231 Passenger cabin, LH 811 Main door D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-13-02 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-S-81733 TYPE IV-12 Sealant P/S 870C-12 AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Central I IPC 53-21-00 1 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the main door I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) If the roller (2) was removed, install it as follows: (a) Put the roller on the backstop. (b) Install the screw (1), washer (3), nut (4) and the cotter pin (5). (2) Put the step fold-out backstop (13) in the correct position. (3) Install the bolts (6) (3 positions), washers (7) (3 positions) and (8) (3 positions), the shims (10) and nuts (9) (3 positions). (4) Put the thermoacoustic blanket (12) in its correct position. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Check for the correct adjustment of step fold-out backstop ( AMM TASK 52-10-01-820-802-A/500). (2) Install the first skirting lining panel (10), the one near the main door (AMM TASK 25-23-02-400-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 25-23-02-400-802-A/400), as applicable. (3) Install the emergency equipment stowage unit (AMM TASK 25-26-03-400-801-A/400, if applicable) or the LH wardrobe (AMM TASK 25-26-04-400-801-A/400 or TASK 25-24-04-400-803-A or AMM TASK 25-26-04-400-804-A/400) or the windscreen (AMM TASK 25-27-04-400-801-A/400, if applicable) or the LH galley (AMM TASK 25-30-07-400-801-A/400), as applicable. (4) Close the main door (AMM SDS 52-10-00/1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-13-02 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
